properties.question: What is the primary indication for conducting an electroencephalogram (EEG) in an adult experiencing malaise or loss of consciousness presumed to be of epileptic origin?
properties.option_a: To diagnose a potential brain tumor
properties.option_b: To evaluate for possible stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA)
properties.option_c: To monitor brain activity and detect abnormalities indicative of epilepsy
properties.option_d: To assess the extent of cerebral aneurysm
